title: 4C/ID Model-Based Job Training Program for Developing Differentiated Instruction Skills in Elementary Teachers (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in educational principles and instructional theories
context.additional_context: A program systematically developing differentiated instruction design and implementation competencies for pre-service elementary teachers, integrating online and offline activities for practice-oriented classroom application

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of designing differentiated mathematics instruction by utilizing the four components of the 4C/ID model: learning tasks, supportive information, procedural information, and part-task practice
Learners can apply specific differentiation strategies (task modification, material reorganization, etc.) that consider students with varying learning paces to actual classroom scenarios
Learners can revise their instructional design plans based on peer feedback and establish effective lesson execution strategies
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
